Item.text: Keep going you two!
Let's keep practicing!
_user_ and Jordan, you did a good job working through that resume. I know documents can be tricky!
I agree! Cristina, I think that I need some help looking at another document.
Ok Jordan, Let's see what you have!
Well, I just got this in the mail. Maybe, you and _user_ could take a look and then help me decide what to do with it.
_user_, let's take a look at this document for Jordan. When you are done, please click to continue at the bottom.
I am learning a lot today!
Let's keep going!
I hope you learned more about documents and the important pieces needed to read, complete, and them.
_user_ you really helped me today! Thank you so much! See you next time.
Now that we have helped Jordan get some of his documents in order. Next time, Jordan will be ready to put in an application for a new job.I can't wait to see you two again. Goodbye!
_user_ and Jordan, Welcome back! How are you? Today we will be helping Jordan with some new documents.
Cristina, I don't know much about documents. How do I know if something I am reading is a document?

Jordan, I thought you would never ask. A document is a piece of written, printed, or electronic matter that provides information, evidence, or serves as an official record. I think we should look at a couple of examples before we get started on today's activity.
Ok I think I get it. So a document kind of keeps track of information, like a written record of some sort.

That's right. There are a few key things to remember about documents. First, documents provide information, this example utility bill gives information about how much energy was used over the course of a payment period. Second, the purpose of documents is to inform. It informs us about the date that an action must be performed. Some documents require action to be taken. In this case, the action is the payment due August fifteenth. The total amount due shows how much needs to be paid by that date.
What about this receipt? I feel like a receipt provides information and is informative, but it doesn't require an action.

That's true Jordan. Not all documents will require action. This example shows a receipt. A receipt informs you about items that were purchased. Its purpose is to help you remember by giving a record of when, where and what items were purchased as well as how the items were purchased.

OK, I get it. From what you have said, I think a resume would be a type of document. I just finished my first resume. I found a job listing that I really want to apply for but I want to make sure that I did my resume correctly first. _user_, will you look over it with me?
Great idea, Jordan. A resume is a very important type of document. Let's get started. Read over Jordan's resume and click continue at the bottom of the page to move on to the rest of the activity.
Alright! Let's keep on going.

Question.text: Here is the first question. Which of the following best states the purpose of a resume?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The purpose of this document is to provide a summary of skills, abilities, and accomplishments.

Question.text: Which email will be the easiest for people to remember and also look professional?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: jordan dot smith 03 at c net dot com is the smartest style. Having an appropriate email is an important part of your first impression with an employer. Remember, it is best to avoid email addresses with your nickname, hobby, pet's name or any other personal information besides your name.

Answer.text: There will charge a late fee of 5 percent equivalent to $32.50 will be added to rent.

Question.text: What services does the landlord provide for the tenants?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: The landlord will provide paid maintenance and repair. The tenants are responsible for paying the utilities and for the trash pickup.

Question.text: Will Jordan be able to keep his pet fish?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: Jordan will be able to keep his pet fish. However, this rental agreement states that he will need permission from Mr. Miller as well as to pay additional rental fees.

Question.text: What changes will Jordan be able to make to his new house?

Answer.name: Correct
Answer.text: No changes can be made to this house without consent. Jordan and Nicholas will need permission from Mr. Miller to change anything from the yard and landscaping to just painting the walls.
